text:
While both the file and resource options ignore missing targets, the url option
causes a build exception. Example file included below:

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<project name="BadProperty" default="test">
  <target name="test">
      <property file="/no/file/build.properties"/> <!-- OK -->
      <property resource="no/resource/here/build.properties"/> <!-- ALSO OK -->
      <property url="http://lalaland.lab/build.properties"/> <!-- BARFS -->
  </target>
</project>
creator: wascallywabbit@earthling.net
stevel@apache.org
text:
I'm not sure if we're going to fix this. Not without breaking things.

I think a better solution would be to extend loadproperties to have a
failonerror attribute, with the default being true. As loadproperties takes a
url resource, it will then have the behaviour you need, without any risk to
other people's builds.
